title: Arugula and Parmigiano Salad
introduction: A delightful mix of crisp and peppery flavors, this Arugula and Parmigiano Salad brings together the nutty taste of arugula with the richness of Parmigiano-Reggiano. Perfectly balanced with a touch of balsamic vinegar and extra-virgin olive oil, this salad captures the essence of Italian cuisine. Whether using home-grown Italian arugula or a local variety, it's a refreshing and sophisticated dish that can be enhanced with toasted walnuts for an extra crunch.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Trim the tough stems of the arugula and discard any yellowed or bruised leaves. Wash the arugula in several changes of cool water. Dry very well. Tear the arugula into bite-size pieces.

In a large bowl, drizzle the arugula with the oil and toss well. In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar and salt and pepper until the salt is dissolved. Pour the vinegar over the salad and toss again. Taste for seasoning. Pile the salad onto serving plates.
With a vegetable peeler, shave the cheese over the salad. Serve immediately.
variations: Top this salad with toasted walnuts for added crunch.
